{{Notability|date=April 2010}} [[File:Robert Meeropol holding copy of RFC newsletter 01.jpg|thumb|Robert Meeropol (2009) holding a copy of the RFC newsletter.]] The '''Rosenberg Fund for Children''' (RFC) is a public foundation started in 1990 by [[Robert Meeropol]] and named in honor of his parents [[Ethel and Julius Rosenberg]], the only two [[United States]] civilians executed for conspiracy to commit [[espionage]] during the [[Cold War]].
Orphaned at age 6, Robert was adopted by Anne and [[Abel Meeropol]]. {{quote|text= After my parentsâ€™ arrests, my relatives were so frightened of being associated with "communist spies" that they refused to take me into their homes. First I lived in a shelter. Later I lived with friends of my parents in New Jersey, but I was thrown out of school after the Board of Education found out who I was. After my parents' execution, the police even seized me from the home of my future adoptive parents, and I was placed in an orphanage. |sign=Robert Meeropol|source=Rosenberg Fund Website - "Our Story" <ref>[http://www.rfc.org/ourstory RFC website]</ref>}} At a fundraiser on the 50th anniversary of his parents' execution, Robert described the fund, which he runs, as his "constructive revenge." <ref>[http://www.usatoday.com/news/nation/2003-06-17-rosenbergs_x.htm USA Today 2003-06-17.]</ref>
The fund "makes grants to aid children in the U.S. whose parents are targeted, progressive activists" and to "assist youth who themselves have been targeted as a result of their progressive activities."<ref>[http://www.rfc.org Home page], Rosenberg Fund for Children, accessed online 2009-10-05.</ref> They do not pay for legal expenses.<ref>[http://www.rfc.org/frequentlyaskedquestions FAQs], Rosenberg Fund for Children, accessed online 2009-10-05.</ref> {{As of|2008}}, the organization has given over $3.4 million in grants to more than 400 children since 1990.<ref>[http://www.rfc.org/factsheet Fact Sheet], Rosenberg Fund for Children, accessed online 2009-10-05.</ref>
